issue.subject: Remove geometry in WFS request from mod_perimeter and mod_location when not necessary
issue.description: To boost the answer speed of mod_perimeter and mod_location, using WFS request, the un necessary geometry should be renmoved from the GML answer (already inmplemented in the MAP component).

journals.notes:
So basicaly according to the spec we need to specify the "PropertyName" key with a comma-separated value.

Example:
http://localhost:8080/geoserver/wfs?request=GetFeature&SERVICE=WFS&TYPENAME=topp:states&VERSION=1.0.0&PropertyName=topp:STATE_NAME

returns:
@
<gml:featureMember>
   <topp:states fid="states.1">
      <topp:STATE_NAME>Illinois</topp:STATE_NAME>
    </topp:states>
</gml:featureMember>
@

and many attriubtes:

http://localhost:8080/geoserver/wfs?request=GetFeature&SERVICE=WFS&TYPENAME=topp:states&VERSION=1.0.0&PropertyName=topp:STATE_NAME,topp:SUB_REGION

returns:
@
<gml:featureMember>
   <topp:states fid="states.1">
      <topp:STATE_NAME>Illinois</topp:STATE_NAME>
      <topp:SUB_REGION>E N Cen</topp:SUB_REGION>
   </topp:states>
</gml:featureMember>
@

Now I'm not sure of this feature implementation for Mapserver, actually for the live instance we have (acv). After some test I did not succeed so I think it does not support it now.
On Mapserver (5.0.2) the PropertyName simply seems to be ignored.

Hi Xavier,

I guess that such issue can be rejected as perimeter's definition and location has been totally rewritten in easySDI V4 ?

Thanks for your feedback.
Bruno

Well, it has been rewritten but I did not check yet if the behaviour has changed.

TODO on my side !
